Yes (currently or at some point in time).19_Other (please specify): All projects takes significantly longer to complete - beyond frustrating
It saves on fuel and the design aspect can be usually done faster due to no external interruptions
Access to machinery for R&D and Testing
Availability: (Linked to informal knowledge sharing). Ideas can get lost and then forgotten if the person you want to bounce them off isn't there in the moment.
Better collaboration with international teams helped by technology
Clients that have outdated ideas are suspicious or resentful of consultants who don't come to sit in a physical office 5 days a week. Bad managers can't measure output rather than attendance
Communication and sharing of information.
Difficult to contact customers who work from home
Escalation of process & decisions has been delayed
Fairness across all departments as manufacturing needs to be in the factory and management need to support this.

Hybrid and remote working have been positive for appealing to more women in a male dominated industry for caring or childcare, this will become more important with flexible working tending to be related to 'where' people work and not for 'how long'.
In the area of administration
Makes life simpler for senior managment
More efficient use of time
New staff induction / integration
People work more due to flexible schedules
Retention
Team building and relationship development
Team cohesion - remote/hybrid working only benefits the individual who wants it, there are absolutely no benefits to the performance of the team
Testing of new innovations
We do no use.
Willingness of employees to help each other
Without remote and hybrid working our business model would not function.
none of the above
